member.name: T:Dapplo.Ini.Converters.StringEncryptionTypeConverter
member.summary: This converter makes it possible to store values in an ini file, somewhat secure. Please make sure to initialize the RgbKey/RgbIv before it is used.

member.name: M:Dapplo.Ini.Converters.StringEncryptionTypeConverter.#ctor
member.summary: The constructor validates all settings

member.name: P:Dapplo.Ini.Converters.StringEncryptionTypeConverter.Algorithm
member.summary: The algorithm to use for the encrypt/decrypt, default is Rijndael

member.name: P:Dapplo.Ini.Converters.StringEncryptionTypeConverter.RgbIv
member.summary: The initialization vector to use for the symmetric algorithm.

member.name: P:Dapplo.Ini.Converters.StringEncryptionTypeConverter.RgbKey
member.summary: The secret key to use for the symmetric algorithm.

member.name: M:Dapplo.Ini.Converters.StringEncryptionTypeConverter.CanConvertFrom(System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext,System.Type)
member.summary: Can we convert from? As we decrypt from a string, the sourceType needs to be string

member.name: M:Dapplo.Ini.Converters.StringEncryptionTypeConverter.CanConvertTo(System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext,System.Type)
member.summary: Can we convert to? As we create a string, the destinationType needs to be string

member.name: M:Dapplo.Ini.Converters.StringEncryptionTypeConverter.ConvertFrom(System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext,System.Globalization.CultureInfo,System.Object)
member.summary: To decrypt call this

member.name: M:Dapplo.Ini.Converters.StringEncryptionTypeConverter.ConvertTo(System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext,System.Globalization.CultureInfo,System.Object,System.Type)
member.summary: To encrypt call this

member.name: M:Dapplo.Ini.Converters.StringEncryptionTypeConverter.Decrypt(System.String)
member.summary: A simply decryption, can be used to store passwords

member.name: M:Dapplo.Ini.Converters.StringEncryptionTypeConverter.Encrypt(System.String)
member.summary: A simply encryption, can be used to store passwords
member.returns: an encryped string in base64 form

member.summary: Scan the supplied directories for files which match the passed file pattern

member.name: M:Dapplo.Ini.IniConfig.ReadFromStreamAsync(System.IO.Stream,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Initialize the IniConfig by reading all the properties from the stream If this is called directly after construction, no files will be read which is useful for testing!

member.name: M:Dapplo.Ini.IniConfig.ReloadAsync(System.Boolean,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: This is reloading all the .ini files, and will refill the sections. If reset = true, ALL setting are lost Otherwise only the properties in the files will overwrite your settings. Usually this should not directly be called, unless you know that the file was changed by an external process.

member.name: M:Dapplo.Ini.IniConfig.ReloadInternalAsync(System.Boolean,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: This is reloading all the .ini files, and will refill the sections. If reset = true, ALL setting are lost Otherwise only the properties in the files will overwrite your settings. Usually this should not directly be called, unless you know that the file was changed by an external process.

member.name: M:Dapplo.Ini.IniConfig.ResetAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Reset all the values, in all the registered ini sections, to their defaults

member.name: M:Dapplo.Ini.IniConfig.ResetInternal
member.summary: Reset all the values, in all the registered ini sections, to their defaults Important, this only works for types that extend IDefaultValue

member.name: M:Dapplo.Ini.IniConfig.WriteAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Write the ini file

member.name: T:Dapplo.Ini.IniEventTypes

member.name: F:Dapplo.Ini.IniEventTypes.Reset
member.summary: This is used to tell the subscriber that a reset was triggered on the IIniConfig

member.name: F:Dapplo.Ini.IniEventTypes.Loaded
member.summary: This is used to tell the subscriber that the IIniConfig was (re)loaded

member.name: F:Dapplo.Ini.IniEventTypes.Saving
member.summary: This is used to tell the subscriber that the IIniConfig is going to be saved

member.name: F:Dapplo.Ini.IniEventTypes.Saved
member.summary: This is used to tell the subscriber that the IIniConfig was saved

member.name: T:Dapplo.Ini.IniPropertyBehaviorAttribute
member.summary: Use this attribute on Properties where you want to influence the ini config behavior.

member.name: M:Dapplo.Ini.IniPropertyBehaviorAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor

member.name: P:Dapplo.Ini.IniPropertyBehaviorAttribute.IgnoreErrors
member.summary: Set ignore errors to false, if you want an exception when a parse error occurs. Default this is set to true, which will cause the property to have the "default" value.

member.name: P:Dapplo.Ini.IniPropertyBehaviorAttribute.IsIgnoreErrorsSet
member.summary: Specifies if the IgnoreErrors was specified or is default

member.name: P:Dapplo.Ini.IniPropertyBehaviorAttribute.Read
member.summary: Default is true, set read to false to skip reading. Although this might be unlikely, examples are: 1 A property with the last changed date, which might not be the date of the file 2 A property with the application or component version which "processed" the configuration

member.name: P:Dapplo.Ini.IniPropertyBehaviorAttribute.Write
member.summary: Default is true, set write to false to skip serializing.

member.name: T:Dapplo.Ini.IniRest
member.summary: This class implements a "REST" API for the Ini configuration

member.name: M:Dapplo.Ini.IniRest.ProcessRestCommand(Dapplo.Ini.IniRestCommand)
member.summary: Process the supplied IniRestCommand

member.name: M:Dapplo.Ini.IniRest.ProcessRestUri(System.Uri)
member.summary: Process an Rest URI, this can be used to read or write values via e.g. a HttpListener format: schema://hostname:port/IniConfig/Command/Applicationname/Configname/Section/Property/NewValue(optional)?query schema is not important, this can be an application specific thing hostname is not important, this can be an application specific thing port is not important, this can be an application specific thing The command is get/set/add/remove/reset the Applicationname and Configname must be registered by new IniConfig(Applicationname,Configname) The Section is that which is used in the IniSection The property needs to be available NewValue is optional (read) can be used to set the property (write) The query can be used to add values to lists (?item1&item2&item2) or dictionaries (?key1=value1& key2=value2) Or when removing from lists (?item1&item2&item2) or dictionaries (?key1&key2) P.S. You can use the ProtocolHandler to register a custom URL protocol.
member.returns: IniRestCommand with all details and the result

member.name: T:Dapplo.Ini.IniRestCommands
member.summary: The supported commands for the ini-REST api

member.name: F:Dapplo.Ini.IniRestCommands.Set
member.summary: Set a value

member.name: F:Dapplo.Ini.IniRestCommands.Get
member.summary: Get a value

member.name: F:Dapplo.Ini.IniRestCommands.Reset
member.summary: Reset a value (to it's default)

member.name: F:Dapplo.Ini.IniRestCommands.Add
member.summary: Add a value to a collection
